definition: suffix of a noun of locality

a person who regularly walks by the river cannot avoid getting their shoes wet (proverb)/(fig.) it comes with the territory (e.g. a person with the power to grant favors will inevitably succumb to temptation and take a bribe)
pinyin: chang2 zai4 he2 bian1 zou3 , na3 you3 bu4 shi1 xie2
containing_words.word: 常在河邊走，哪有不濕鞋

sentences.english: People washing clothes by the river.
sentences.chinese: 人們在石潭河邊洗衣服。

sentences.english: This company expands to the riverside.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司的地界擴展到河邊。

sentences.english: He has often cast this brook.
Day soldiers had held several Oriental army horse to the river to bathe a charger.
sentences.chinese: 日兵們果然拉着幾匹東洋軍馬來河邊給軍馬洗澡了。
他常在這條小河邊釣魚。

sentences.english: This morning, I come to the riverside to taken my Foto.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨我去河邊拍攝照片了。

sentences.english: We found a grassy spot beside a river.
sentences.chinese: 我們找到河邊的一個綠草如茵的地方。

sentences.english: The valley bottoms out by the river.
sentences.chinese: 山谷地勢漸低直至河邊。

sentences.english: When I was in the  countryside, I often walked by the  riverside.
sentences.chinese: 我在鄉下時經常在河邊散步。

sentences.english: He threw off his coat as he neared the riverbank.
sentences.chinese: 他邊跑近河邊，邊把衣服脫了下來。

sentences.english: The glow of a funeral pyre slowly dies by the silent river.
sentences.chinese: 火葬灰中的紅光在沉靜的河邊慢慢地熄滅下去。

sentences.english: We prepared a picnic and drove down by the river.
sentences.chinese: 我們準備好了野餐，開車沿着河邊一路駛去。

sentences.english: But soon Carnegie was seen practicing public speaking on the riverside.
sentences.chinese: 但是很快人們又看到卡內基在河邊練習演講了。

sentences.english: He used to live in a cottage near the river.
sentences.chinese: 他常住在河邊的一座小木房裏。

sentences.english: Our property goes all the way down to the river.
sentences.chinese: 我們的宅地一直延伸到河邊。

sentences.english: My sister went to the river and A Fu followed her.
sentences.chinese: 年試題中表達“妹妹走向河邊阿福跟隨。

definition: to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
